put.summary: Updates an admin user.
put.description: Update an admin user's roles, or password. It is possible to update the user roles without updating the password, (leave out the password in the request body). It is possible to update the user's password only, (leave out the adminUser in the request body). It is possible to update the user's roles and password at the same time. The id or name of a user cannot be updated.The password is sent in the clear in the request body, but this will be sent over SSL. The password is encrypted before being written to the Admin User Store, i.e. the VDISTDIR/conf/adminUsers.json file.

post.summary: Upload a Policy Archive as multipart/form-data for a group of API Servers.
post.description: A client application may need to deploy a separate Policy Archive (.pol) and Environment Archive (.env) to a group of API Servers, e.g. a web-based application, as it cannot merge the .pol and .env to create a Deployment Archve (.fed) locally. For a .pol and .env deployment, the API method described here must be invoked as Step 1.The steps for deployment of a Policy Archive (.pol) and Environment Archive (.env) to a group of API Servers, (when the client application cannot merge the .pol and .env to create a .fed), are as follows:-Step 1: Upload the Policy Archive by invoking the method described here. The Node Manager copies the Policy Archive to its local disk. This method returns the id of the Policy Archive to the client application. The policy archive id must be passed in Step 2 of the .pol and .env deployment as the query string parameter relatedPolicyArchiveID.Step 2: Upload the Environment Archive, by invoking POST /api/deployment/group/configuration/file/environment/{groupID}. The Node Manager creates a merged Deployment Archive and replicates it to all hosts running API Servers in the group. This method returns the id of the Deployment Archive to the client application. The Deployment Archive id must be passed in Step 3 of the .pol and .env deployment.Step 3: Invoke the Configuration API method PUT /api/configuration?archiveId={archiveId} on each API Server in the group via the Routing API in the Node Manager to get the API Server to load the new configuration.

post.summary: Upload an Environment Archive as multipart/form-data for a group of API Servers. This is merged with a related Policy Archive to create a Deployment Archive.
post.description: A client application may need to deploy a separate Policy Archive (.pol) and Environment Archive (.env) to a group of API Servers, e.g. a web-based application, as it cannot merge the .pol and .env to create a Deployment Archve (.fed) locally. For a .pol and .env deployment, the API method described here must be invoked as Step 2.The steps for deployment of a Policy Archive (.pol) and Environment Archive (.env) to a group of API Servers, (when the client application cannot merge the .pol and .env to create a .fed), are as follows:-Step 1: Upload the Policy Archive by invoking POST /api/deployment/group/configuration/file/policy/{groupID}. The Node Manager copies the Policy Archive to its local disk. This method returns the id of the Policy Archive to the client application. The policy archive id must be passed in Step 2 of the .pol and .env deployment as the query string parameter relatedPolicyArchiveID.Step 2: Upload the Environment Archive, by invoking the method described here. The Node Manager creates a merged Deployment Archive and replicates it to all hosts running API Servers in the group. This method returns the id of the Deployment Archive to the client application. The Deployment Archive id must be passed in Step 3 of the .pol and .env deployment.Step 3: Invoke the Configuration API method PUT /api/configuration?archiveId={archiveId} on each API Server in the group via the Routing API in the Node Manager to get the API Server to load the new configuration.

post.summary: Update Deployment Archive manifest properties.
post.description: Update Deployment Archive manifest properties. This method will ensure that the properties are updated on all hosts that have this Deployment Archive on disk for the group. Note that the existing properties are completely overwritten. Updates to read-only properties e.g. Id, Timestamp, are ignored.The configuration content is not updated. Configuration refresh requests are not sent to the API Servers.

post.summary: Update metadata relating to a configuration for a group on the local host.
post.description: This method is called by an Admin Node Manager on a remote Node Manager.  This method is used to update metadata relating to a configuration for a group on the local host. Calling this method does *not* result in a redeployment of the configuration to the API Gateways in the group. The metadata that can be updated are the set of properties that are related to policy or the environment parts of the configuration.This method should not be called by client app. A client app should call /archive/{groupID}/{archiveID}/properties/{type} method to update configuration metadata.

get.summary: Gets metric summary for a Metric Group
get.description: This method gets metric totals for a Metric Group Type (or specific named group) for a time window. Totals metrics give a total count for the metric values since the API Server when started. Totals metrics may be used to give a summary of metric data. They should not be used to graph metric data over time. The set of values returned will depend on the type of the metric group, as different metrics are generated for different metric group types.

parameters.name: metricGroupType
parameters.description: The metric group type, e.g. "Service", "Client", "TargetServer

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The metric group name. If the name is not specified, it sums all of the groups of the metricGroupType together.

parameters.name: timeline
parameters.description: The time window interval; one of 10m, 10h, 5d This defaults to *10m*.

parameters.name: instance
parameters.description: The unique ID for an API Server instance in the domain.

200.description: Success. The response body contains a list of maps of metrics.

get.summary: Gets metric timeline for a Metric Group
get.description:
Timeline metrics may be used to graph metric values over time. If real-time monitoring is enabled, the API Server maintains in-memory metrics for 3 timeline periods as follows:-

the last 10 minutes
the last 10 hours
the last 5 days
For each timeline period, 120 data points are maintained. This means:-

for the 10 minute timeline period, there is a data point every 5 seconds
for the 10 hour timeline period, there is a data point every 5 minutes
for the 5 day timeline period, there is a data point every 1 hour.
This means that the data is at its most fine-grained for the shortest timeline period

parameters.name: metricGroupType
parameters.description: The metric group type, e.g. "Service", "Client", "TargetServer". This defaults to *SystemOverview*.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The metric group name. If the name is not specified, it sums all of the groups of the *metricGroupType* together.

parameters.name: metricType
parameters.description: The metric type name; multiple names can be specified for additional series. This defaults to *successes*

parameters.name: timeline
parameters.description: The time window interval; one of 10m, 10h, 5d This defaults to *10m*

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: An ISO-8601 standard web date (e.g. 2012-04-11T14:09:50Z) or a reference (e.g. 5minutes) If not specified, it defaults to the full timeline interval.

parameters.name: instance
parameters.description: The unique ID for an API Server instance in the domain.

200.description: Success. The response body contains a list of maps of metrics.

404.description: Metrics are requested for a metric group that does not currently exist in memory, or, an attempt is made to request an unsupported timeline period.

post.summary: Adds a service (e.g. API Server instance) to the Topology
post.description: This method adds a service to the Topology. A service is an API Server instance, or Node Manager.When a new API Server instance is added, new files will be created on disk for the new instance.

put.summary: Update a service name, tags, management port, etc
put.description: This method may be used to update a service's name, tags, management port, or scheme.A service is an API Server instance, or Node Manager.The id or type cannot be updated.

get.summary: Get the service specified by serviceID from the group specified by groupID.
get.description: Get a service with an id of serviceID in group with id of groupID from the topology.

delete.summary: Delete a service from the topology.
delete.description: Delete a service from the topology.

get.summary: Get a service id.
get.description: Get a service id.

get.summary: Get the status of the specified service.
get.description: Get the status of the specified service.

post.summary: Merges a snippet of a Topology into the main Domain Topology
post.description: Used to merge a snippet of a Topology or a Host specific topology into the Domain Topology. The main use is to re-add a Host which may have temporarily removed from the Topology (either due to Host or Network failure). Note that it is assumed that Topology snippet being merged refereces Hosts, Groups and Instances which have allready been configured and established previously. No disk changes are made when loading this change.

get.summary: Returns the Status of All NodeManagers in the domain.
get.description: Returns the state of the Node Managers in the domain, giving their installed topology version and admin user store version (if applicable). Shows overall status of the domain, i.e. if all Node Managers can be contacted and are up to date.

parameters.name: refresh
parameters.description: Set the refresh parameter to true will contact each NM for update. Otherwise the latest DomainStatus is returned. Default is true.

get.summary: Returns the FIPS mode status for the instance
get.description: Returns the status of the FIPS mode for the Domain, the setting for the Instance, and the current running mode

post.summary: Register E-Gateway in the topology.
post.description: Add E-Gateway to topology if it does not exist. A host and group are created as required. If already exists then this is an indication that the E-Gateway is still running.

post.summary: Delete a service from the topology.
post.description: Delete a service from the topology. Host and Group are deleted if now empty

post.summary: Create a signed certificate for SSL communications
post.description: Create a signed certificate for SSL communications

post.summary: Create a private key and CSR for SSL communications for an API Gateway
post.description: Generate a private key and CSR (Certificate Sign Request) for an instance.The CSR may be taken offline so that an external CA can create the signed certificate, or the CSR may be sent back to the Admin Node Manager where the domain private key resides in order to create the signed certificate.This method is called by a client application (e.g. managedomain), on an Admin Node Manager when a new instance is being created.

get.summary: Get the group specified by groupID
get.description: Get the group specified by groupID from the topology.

delete.summary: Delete the group specified by groupID
delete.description: Delete the group specified by groupID from the topology.

get.summary: Get the Topology version.
get.description: Returns the the topology version (version and timestamp) as the result on a successful operation

post.summary: Lock a Group for exclusive access.
post.description: Lock a Group for exclusive access by a user. Once locked, only the locking user can deploy configuration to the Group or Server instances under the Group. Equally, only the locking user can modify the Group. Only the original locker can unlock the Group, or another user with sufficient privileges to force an unlock of the Group, usually a user with an Administrator role in their user privileges.The lock which gets generated has the username and timestamp of when it was created and is a sub-object of the Group.

delete.summary: Force the unlocking of a Group irrespective of the original locker.
delete.description: Force the unlocking of a Group for exclusive access, irrespective of the original locker. Typically only users with administrative access can call this, as defined in the RBAC configuration.

post.summary: Adds a service (e.g. API Server instance) to the Topology
post.description: This method adds a service to the Topology. A service is an API Server instance, or Node Manager. When a new API Server instance is added, new files will be created on disk for the new instance.The certificates for the new instance or Node Manager are passed to this method. The certificate has been signed either by 1) an Admin Node Manager with the domain private key, or, 2) managedomain using a user-provided domain private key, or 3) an external CA that was sent the CSR (Certificate Sign Request) generated in a previous API call.

get.summary: Get a host id.
get.description: Get a host id.

get.summary: Gets a Store object.
get.description: Gets the specified object from the specified store.

parameters.name: instance
parameters.description: The unique ID for an API Server instance in the domain.

put.summary: Creates an object with a client side generated id OR Updates an object.
put.description: Creates or updates an object.The primary ID is specified in the request.If the server generates the primary ID then the POST method should be used.For object creation, both the primary ID and the secondary ID (if defined) must be specified.For object update, the primary ID must be specified.Other properties are optional.To update a property specify its new value.To delete a property set the value to null.It is not currently possible to partially update a Map or a List property.All properties of the Map or List must be specified for this case.

parameters.name: instance
parameters.description: The unique ID for an API Server instance in the domain.

delete.description: Deletes an object with a client side generated id

parameters.name: instance
parameters.description: The unique ID for an API Server instance in the domain.

get.summary: Gets the first {batchSize} objects in a store.
get.description:
Gets the first {batchSize} objects in a store.This method can be used to iterate over rows in a KPS table. Filters can be applied to restrict the rows that are returned. Cursors are automatically closed after 10 minutes of inactivity in order to free resources on the server.

Example: Suppose a cursor is opened with the following URL:
https://localhost:8090/api/router/service/api-server-instance-id/api/kps/cursor/open/100/cities?name=yo&country=USA&country=france
\nThis retrieves rows from the 'cities' KPS table, where cities are filtered by name and country. The following points are worth noting:
\n* propName is case sensitive, so 'country' and 'Country' refer to different properties.
* filterValue is case insensitive, so 'USA' and 'usa' are equivalent.
* A match occurs if a property value *contains* the filterValue. So filter 'name=yo' will match rows where city name is New York, Lyon, etc.
* A row is only returned if *ALL* property filters match. So if filter is 'name=yo&country=USA', a row will only be returned if both conditions are true.
* If more than one filterValue is specified for a property, a row is returned if *ANY* of them match. So if filter is 'country=USA&country=france', a row will 
be returned if the country is either USA or France.

parameters.name: instance
parameters.description: The unique ID for an API Server instance in the domain.

get.summary: Gets the next {batchSize} objects in a store.
get.description: This method can be used to iterate over rows in a KPS table. Filters can be applied to restrict the rows that are returned.Cursors are automatically closed after 10 minutes of inactivity in order to free resources on the server.

parameters.name: instance
parameters.description: The unique ID for an API Server instance in the domain.

get.summary: Iterates through objects. Start iteration.
get.description: THESE REST METHODS HAVE BEEN DEPRECATED. To iterate over the rows in a KPS table, use the cursor method instead./api/kps/iterator/start - Gets the first {batchSize} objects in a store./api/kps/iterator/next - Gets the next {batchSize} objects in a store.Note: These methods support one client per API Gateway at a time. Concurrent clients are not supported.

parameters.name: instance
parameters.description: The unique ID for an API Server instance in the domain.

get.summary: Iterates through objects. Next iteration
get.description: THESE REST METHODS HAVE BEEN DEPRECATED. To iterate over the rows in a KPS table, use the cursor method instead./api/kps/iterator/start - Gets the first {batchSize} objects in a store./api/kps/iterator/next - Gets the next {batchSize} objects in a store.Note: These methods support one client per API Gateway at a time. Concurrent clients are not supported.

parameters.name: instance
parameters.description: The unique ID for an API Server instance in the domain.

get.summary: Filters Store objects
get.description:
This method returns objects in the specified table that match a specified filter. If any property in any object in the table contains the value of this filter then the object is included in the result set. List and Map object properties are converted to Strings before being compared. A case insensitive comparision is used.
 By default the method returns 100 records. Up to 1000 records can be retrieved using the HTTP header Range, 1000 being the max value for upper bound. The header specifies position of start and end object, inclusive, in the format: "Range: items=start-end". E.g.: "Range: "items=10-500".

parameters.name: storeAlias
parameters.description: Alias of store to get objects from.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: A query parameter named filter. If not specified then no filter is applied and all objects are returned. Format: "/kps/{storeAlias}?filter={filter}". E.g.: "/kps/employees?filter=joe."

parameters.name: instance
parameters.description: The unique ID for an API Server instance in the domain.

200.description: Success. The response body contains the required objects. NOTE: an empty array indicates that no objects were found. A Content-Range header specifies the start position, end position, and total number of objects found (max upper bound: 1000). Format: "Content-Range: items startIndex-endIndex/totalObjects", e.g., "items 0-99/1000/".

404.description: Fail. KPS has not been configured on this node or the specified store does not exist

500.description: Fail. An internal server error occurred.

post.summary: Creates an object with server side generated id.
post.description: Creates an object where the the object id (primary key) is auto-generated on the server side.For client generated object id please use the PUT method.If a secondary key is defined for the store, values must be provided for all of its constituent properties.Other property values are optional.

parameters.name: instance
parameters.description: The unique ID for an API Server instance in the domain.

parameters.description: The unique ID for an API Server instance in the domain.

get.description: Composite key query. Retrieves a unique row from the specified KPS table given a query of the form: columnA=x&columnB=y& ...

name.description: The friendly name for the report.

levels.description: The custom report levels definitions.  Only two levels are supported.

type.description: The report level type, one of: SystemOverview, Service, Client, ServiceUsagePerClient, ServiceUsagePerMethod, RemoteHost, or InboundProtocol

chart.description: The chart type, one of: line

visible.description: Indicates whether or not the field should appear in the summary report.

name.description: The friendly name for the query

fieldsToSelect.description: The list of fields to select

summary.description: Produce an audit trail summary (condense to one row per-message)

type.description: The report type to generate, one of: pdf, csv

reportGroup.description: The report group type, one of: SystemOverview, Service, Client, ServiceUsagePerClient, ServiceUsagePerMethod, RemoteHost, or InboundProtocol

email.description: Email recipient(s) to receive the generated report.

enabled.description: Enables the scheduled report for generation.

range.description: Indicates the report should be run on a time range, i.e. __fromDate__ is not a specific date.

fromDate.description: The starting date for the report.

toDate.description: The end date for the report.

scheduled.description: The schedule frequency of the report, values one of: daily, weekly, monthly.

generateTime.description: The time at which the report should be generated in a 24 hour HH:MM format.

dayOfWeek.description: The day of the week at which the report should be generated, values one of: mon, tue, wed, thu, fri, sat, sun.

dayOfMonth.description: The day of month at which the report should be generated if __schedule__ is *monthly*, values one of: first, last.

lastRun.description: The timestamp of the last time the report was run.

timeout.description: The maximum amount of time to wait for the report to generate.

details.description: The HTTP summary details about the message.

id.description: The unique identifier for the user

organizationId.description: The unique identifier for the organization to which the user belongs

loginName.description: A unique login name for the user

email.description: An email address for the user

role.description: The user's role, one of: user, oadmin, or admin

image.description: The user's photo. To update the image, please refer to the API.

enabled.description: Indicates whether or not the user account is enabled or not

createdOn.description: Epoch/Unix time stamp when the organization was created

state.description: The current state of the account, one of: approved, pending

type.description: Indicates the type of user. Possible values: internal, external

orgs2Role.description: Maps the organization Id to the user's role for that organization (optional)

orgs2Name.description: Maps the organization Id to the organization name (read-only)

User.description: The API Manager user is a member of organizations.
